LanguageData.Tungsten.label: tungsten alloy
LanguageData.Tungsten.description: Tungsten, also known as Wolfram or Wolframite, is a hard, rare metal. Tungsten's hardness and high density give it military applications in penetrative projectiles. Tungsten compounds are also often used as industrial catalysts. Tungsten is not a magnetic metal.
LanguageData.StelliteAlloy.label: stellite alloy
LanguageData.StelliteAlloy.description: Stellite is a magnetic alloy of Cobalt, Chromium and Tungsten designed for increased wear resistance.
LanguageData.TitaniumBar.label: ferrotitanium alloy
LanguageData.TitaniumBar.description: Ferrotitanium is an alloy of Steel, Titanium and Carbon Fiber Alloy. It is very durable and somewhat beautiful. Ferrotitanium is not a magnetic metal.
LanguageData.NitinolAlloy.label: nitinol alloy
LanguageData.NitinolAlloy.description: Nitinol is an alloy of Nickel and Titanium. Nitinol is exceedingly difficult to make due to the exceptionally tight compositional control required, and the tremendous reactivity of Titanium. It is exceptionally durable and somewhat beautiful. Nitinol is not a magnetic metal.
LanguageData.PobediteAlloy.label: pobedite alloy
LanguageData.PobediteAlloy.description: Pobedite is a magnetic alloy of Carbon Fiber Alloy, Tungsten and Cobalt. This composite alloy possesses a particularly high hardness, similar to that of a diamond.
LanguageData.Titanium.label: titanium alloy
LanguageData.Titanium.description: Titanium is a chemical element. It is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density and high strength. It is highly resistant to corrosion in sea water, aqua regia and chlorine. Titanium is paramagnetic (it becomes attracted to magnetic metals to strengthen the magnetic bond).
LanguageData.AlphaPoly.label: alpha poly
LanguageData.AlphaPoly.description: The first iteration in artificially constructed, atomically assembled dense matter. This man-made, extremely rare material is only assembled in high end matter assemblers and is good for building structures in the chromosphere of stars.
LanguageData.BetaPoly.label: beta poly
LanguageData.BetaPoly.description: The second iteration in artificially constructed, atomically assembled dense matter. This man-made, extremely rare material is too expensive to be mass produced, and has only been used as material for indestructible space suits, unstoppable kinetic slugs and containment for miniature black holes.
